entries.meaning: A stick or rod used to measure the depth of a liquid. Often used to check the level at which a liquid in an opaque or inaccessible tank or reservoir stands; gauge.
examples: I haven't checked the oil level of my car's motor since I lost the dipstick three months ago.

entries.meaning: (slang, derogatory) A useless person of inferior intellect; a dipshit.
examples: That referee is a right dipstick.

verbs.description: dipstick (third-person singular simple present dipsticks, present participle dipsticking, simple past and past participle dipsticked)

entries.meaning: To check (a person) for their understanding of something, as of a lesson, or attitude toward something.
(mechanical engineering) To measure the level of a fluid using a dipstick.
examples: If one of the fuel gauges is inoperative (flight is not permitted if both have failed), the tanks have to be dipsticked before and after each fueling to confirm the aircraft's fuel status.
